hyperedges.text: Sliding work sharing between humans and AI/robots

entities.name: AI
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence

entities.name: Robots
entities.description: Automated machines

entities.name: Humans
entities.description: People in industrial environments

entities.name: Situational context
entities.description: Conditions affecting the balance of work between humans and AI/robots
Citation for a research paper on practical methods for optimal sharing of work
Citation for a research paper defining 'sliding decision making'

hyperedges.text: The term 'sliding work sharing' (SWS) was introduced by AI4Work project proposal [80].

entities.name: sliding work sharing
entities.description: A concept related to automation and task distribution.

hyperedges.text: The related concept of 'sliding autonomy' could be identified.

entities.name: sliding autonomy
entities.description: A concept related to adjustable levels of robot autonomy.

hyperedges.text: Sliding autonomy was researched extensively in the domains of robotics and (multi-)agent systems [82].

entities.name: robotics
entities.description: The study of robots.

entities.name: (multi-)agent systems
entities.description: The study of multiple autonomous entities interacting with each other.

hyperedges.text: The aim is to vary the level of autonomy during operation, depending on the respective situation.
Highly autonomous robots can help reducing the mental load of human operators [83] and they can also be used in hostile environments, where humans may not be able to work [81,84].

entities.name: highly autonomous robots
entities.description: Robots capable of operating independently with minimal human intervention.

hyperedges.text: It is hardly possible (or very time-consuming) to program robots in a way that they can react to all potential challenges that may happen in dynamic real-world environments [81,83,87].
Humans should at least monitor the robots' work and should be able to intervene in case of robots 'being stuck' or in case of potential safety hazards.
Another motivation for sliding autonomy may be to dynamically adjust the robots' autonomy level depending on the skill level of the human who is controlling the robot [86].
Different scenarios regarding sliding autonomy are discussed in the existing literature.
A variety of potential levels of autonomy may be differentiated, e.g. considering the ten levels of automation suggested in [85].
When considering sliding autonomy of robots, the three main levels that are most relevant can be summarized as follows:
• Fully autonomous: the robot is working autonomously, without any human involvement.

entities.name: fully autonomous
entities.description: A level of autonomy where the robot operates independently.

hyperedges.text: Robot requires human support due to unexpected issues

entities.name: Robot
entities.description: Autonomous machine performing tasks

entities.name: Human
entities.description: Entity providing temporary support or taking over control

entities.name: Issue
entities.description: Unexpected event preventing robot from continuing work or decreasing performance

hyperedges.text: Reasons for robot to request human support

entities.name: Robot
entities.description: Autonomous machine performing tasks

entities.name: Blocked/trapped
entities.description: Robot is unable to move or navigate

entities.name: Lost in environment
entities.description: Robot cannot find its way

entities.name: Low self-confidence
entities.description: Robot doubts its ability to succeed in a given task

entities.name: Timeout
entities.description: Robot did not succeed after a specific time or number of tries

entities.name: Task assignment
entities.description: Robot delegates a task to a human in peer-to-peer teams

hyperedges.text: Reasons for human to proactively intervene

entities.name: Human
entities.description: Entity observing robot's work

entities.name: Inefficient work
entities.description: Robot's work could be improved through human intervention

entities.name: Incorrect behavior
entities.description: Robot is behaving abnormally

entities.name: Safety hazard
entities.description: Potential collisions with objects, other robots, or humans

entities.name: Losing the robot
entities.description: Robot may be lost in hostile environments

hyperedges.text: Types of human involvement

entities.name: System-initiative sliding autonomy
entities.description: Human only reacts to robot asking for help

entities.name: Mixed-initiative sliding autonomy
entities.description: Both human and robot can initiate interaction

hyperedges.text: Pre-planned human involvement

entities.name: Human
entities.description: Entity performing a specific task that is hard to automate

entities.name: Task
entities.description: Specific action known in advance that is hard to automate

hyperedges.text: Sliding Autonomy compared to Fully Autonomous Robots and Manual Operation

entities.name: Sliding Autonomy
entities.description: A control strategy that allows for varying levels of autonomy in robots.

entities.name: Experiments
entities.description: Studies conducted to compare the performance of sliding autonomy, fully autonomous robots, and manual operation.

entities.name: Required Time
entities.description: The time taken to complete a task.

entities.name: Error Rate
entities.description: The number of errors made during a task.

entities.name: Workload for Human Operator
entities.description: The amount of effort or mental strain required from the human operator.

entities.name: Fully Autonomous Robots
entities.description: Robots that operate independently without any human intervention.

entities.name: Manual Operation
entities.description: The control of a robot directly by a human operator.

entities.name: SWS
entities.description: An organization focused on finding the ideal balance between human and machine activities.

hyperedges.text: The state of the art regarding sliding autonomy of robots in the upcoming development of SWS mechanisms requires considering a basic difference between robots and AI: humans may find it difficult to determine if an AI is providing low accuracy or untrustworthy answers, especially when learning data sets are small or do not cover all situations in the real work environment.

entities.name: sliding autonomy of robots
entities.description: The ability for a robot to gradually take on more tasks and responsibilities.

entities.name: SWS mechanisms
entities.description: Software systems that manage the interaction between humans and robots in a work environment.

entities.name: AI
entities.description: Artificial intelligence, a system capable of performing tasks that would normally require human intelligence.

entities.name: human
entities.description: A person involved in the work environment.

entities.name: low accuracy or untrustworthy answers
entities.description: Inaccurate or unreliable results provided by AI.

hyperedges.text: Safe AI monitoring and explainable/transparent AI will be important to consider in relation to SWS, especially when working together with an AI that may provide low accuracy or untrustworthy answers.

entities.name: safe AI monitoring
entities.description: Technologies used to ensure the safety and reliability of AI systems.

entities.name: explainable/transparent AI
entities.description: AI systems that can be easily understood and their workings explained.

entities.name: SWS
entities.description: Software systems that manage the interaction between humans and robots in a work environment.

hyperedges.text: The digital twin should model the functioning of the IMA E-CO Flex machine over time, including the instants prior to the fault, to make it possible to observe the state of the machine at the occurrence of the fault and associate a specific fault with a specific operating condition of the machine.

entities.description: Applies the rules of the Sliding Module to current input data.

entities.name: Input Data

entities.description: Controls the flow of inputs and outputs to other systems/components.

entities.description: Keeps use-case-specific workflow definition.

entities.description: Reads the workflow definition and orchestrates the work.

entities.description: Can adapt its behaviour based on the decision/recommendation of the SWS Management component.

entities.name: Custom GUI
entities.description: Shows the decision to an end-user and presents context and estimated uncertainty for explainability.

entities.description: Plans based on AI and long-term adaptation components.

entities.name: Pilot-specific AI modules

entities.description: Provides inputs or sends trigger messages.

entities.name: End user
entities.description: Sends trigger messages about events requiring a 'sliding decision'.

entities.name: Legacy system
entities.description: Acts based on decisions/recommendations of SWS Management component.

entities.name: Pilot-specific GUI
entities.description: Presents information to the human operator and interacts with the legacy system.

entities.description: Assessment of an individual's productivity.

entities.name: well-being
entities.description: Evaluation of an individual's well-being.

entities.name: stress
entities.description: Assessment of an individual's stress level.

entities.name: job satisfaction
entities.description: Evaluation of an individual's job satisfaction.

entities.name: organisational level evaluation
entities.description: Assessment of solutions in collaborative work settings.

entities.name: team productivity
entities.description: Assessment of a team's productivity.

entities.name: team collaboration

entities.name: coordination
entities.description: Assessment of coordination within a team.

entities.name: agility

entities.description: Combination of quantitative and qualitative evaluation methods.

entities.name: pilot applications

entities.description: Recommendations for implementing AI4Work components in other organisations.

entities.name: tool deployments

entities.name: work
entities.description: Performed tasks or duties within an organization.

entities.name: impact evaluation
entities.description: The process of determining the effect or influence of a tool or system on work.

hyperedges.text: Interactive mechanisms for active learning aspects of AI4Work components

entities.name: AI4Work components

entities.description: A machine learning approach that allows models to learn from data and improve over time.

entities.name: interactive mechanisms
entities.description: Tools or features that facilitate user interaction with the system.

entities.name: historical monitoring data
entities.description: Data collected over time about the performance of a system.

entities.name: system aspects
entities.description: Individual components or elements of a system.

hyperedges.text: Establishing best practices and guidelines for future implementation

entities.name: best practices
entities.description: Proven methods or techniques that have consistently produced positive results.

entities.name: guidelines
entities.description: Recommended steps or procedures to follow for successful implementation.

entities.name: future implementation
entities.description: The planned deployment of AI4Work components in various organizations and work environments.

hyperedges.text: Pre- and post-deployment evaluation phases

entities.name: pre-deployment phase
entities.description: The initial evaluation of an organization's state regarding KPIs before the deployment of AI4Work components.

entities.name: post-deployment phase
entities.description: The evaluation of an organization's state regarding KPIs after the deployment of AI4Work components.

entities.name: deployment
entities.description: The implementation of AI4Work components in an organization.

hyperedges.text: Technical KPIs for AI4Work components

entities.name: AI4Work components
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence system designed for work applications.

entities.name: technical capabilities
entities.description: Abilities related to the technical aspects of a system.

entities.name: AI solutions
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence algorithms or models within AI4Work components.

entities.name: human workers
entities.description: People collaborating with AI4Work components.

entities.name: efficiency
entities.description: The ability of a system to perform its functions without wasting resources.

entities.name: accuracy
entities.description: The degree of correctness or truthfulness of the results provided by AI solutions.

entities.name: explainability
entities.description: The ability to interpret and understand the decision-making process of AI solutions.

hyperedges.text: Accuracy KPIs measure the degree to which an AI model generates a correct output for the problem given the available data.

entities.name: Accuracy
entities.description: Degree of correctness in AI model's output.

entities.name: AI model
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence system generating output.

entities.name: Problem
entities.description: Issue or question the AI model is solving.

entities.name: Data
entities.description: Information used by the AI model.

hyperedges.text: Latency measures a system's responsiveness, typically in terms of the time it takes to process one unit of data.

entities.name: Latency
entities.description: System's speed or delay.

entities.name: System
entities.description: AI system being measured.

entities.name: Data
entities.description: Unit of data being processed.

hyperedges.text: Reliability metrics evaluate whether the AI system behaves according to its design intentions.

entities.name: Reliability
entities.description: Degree of adherence to design specifications.

entities.name: AI system
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence system being evaluated.

entities.name: Design intentions
entities.description: Expected behavior or performance of the AI system.

hyperedges.text: Robustness measures the ability of an AI system to perform in varying circumstances, e.g., in variations in the input data and context.

entities.name: Robustness
entities.description: System's adaptability to different conditions.

entities.name: AI system
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence system being assessed.

entities.name: Input data
entities.description: Data provided to the AI system.

entities.name: Context
entities.description: Surrounding conditions affecting the AI system.

hyperedges.text: Safety

entities.name: System's capability to minimise unintentional harm
entities.description: Refers to a system's capability to minimise unintentional harm stemming either from unexpected system actions or misuse of human operators.

entities.name: SWS safety measures
entities.description: Refer to assessing the safety of the CPS's human actors.

entities.name: Safety incidents
entities.description: Recordings of safety incidents.

entities.name: Questionnaires about perceived safety
entities.description: Querying operators about their perceived safety.

entities.name: Logistics pilot
entities.description: Relevant for the logistics pilot.

hyperedges.text: Scalability

entities.name: System's ability to maintain operational capacities
entities.description: A system's ability to maintain its operational capacities in response to changes (typically up-scaling) of processing and input data demands.

entities.name: Performance metrics
entities.description: Measured in terms of variability of performance metrics (e.g., processing time) as a function of varying complexity.
References for scalability.

hyperedges.text: Security

entities.name: System's ability to prevent unintended execution
entities.description: A system's ability to prevent unintended execution.

entities.name: Unauthorised access
entities.description: Refers to unauthorised access.

entities.name: Data leakage
entities.description: Refers to data leakage.

entities.name: External threats and adversarial attacks
entities.description: The AI4Work components should identify and withstand external threats and adversarial attacks.

entities.name: Information integrity
entities.description: A system's ability to maintain information integrity.
References for security.

hyperedges.text: Operational KPIs

entities.name: Performance of operational units
entities.description: Used to measure the performance of operational units.

entities.name: Standardisation work on operational KPIs
entities.description: Extensive standardisation work on operational KPIs exists for example regarding manufacturing and automation.
References for operational KPIs.

entities.name: AI4Work's pilots
entities.description: Applicable to a broader range of processes in AI4Work's pilots.

entities.name: Modularity
entities.description: A necessary condition for the evaluation of AI4Work's contributions because not all of the project's components are uniformly applicable to all pilots.

hyperedges.text: AI4Work components affect operational units in three ways: (1) introducing new tasks and processes, (2) modifying existing tasks and processes with human-AI collaboration characteristics, (3) making certain tasks and processes obsolete.

entities.name: AI4Work components
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence for Work components

entities.name: operational units
entities.description: Units within an operational system

hyperedges.text: Operational KPIs can be used to assess the impact of AI4Work components on a task or process level and evaluate the overarching performance impact on operations in the application environment.

entities.name: Operational KPIs
entities.description: Key Performance Indicators for operational systems

entities.name: AI4Work components
entities.description: Artificial Intelligence for Work components

entities.name: application environment
entities.description: The system where AI4Work is implemented

hyperedges.text: Cost/benefit ratios are measures associating the costs relative to the benefits of a process and are indicative of the potential profit margins of operations.

entities.name: cost/benefit ratios
entities.description: Measures associating costs with benefits

entities.name: process
entities.description: A series of actions or operations

hyperedges.text: Cycle time KPIs measure the elapsed time between initiating and completing a task, process, or machine operation.

entities.name: cycle time KPIs
entities.description: Key Performance Indicators for cycle times

entities.name: task
entities.description: A single action or operation

entities.name: process
entities.description: A series of actions or operations

entities.name: machine operation
entities.description: An action performed by a machine

hyperedges.text: Delivery reliability KPIs measure a supplier's capacity to serve customers on time.

entities.name: delivery reliability KPIs
entities.description: Key Performance Indicators for delivery reliability

entities.name: supplier
entities.description: A provider of goods or services

entities.name: customer
entities.description: A recipient of goods or services

entities.name: AI4Work components

entities.name: Material
entities.description: Physical resources required for deployment

entities.description: Human resources required for deployment and training

entities.name: Process
entities.description: AI4Work process or operation

entities.name: Energy consumption
entities.description: Amount of energy used in the process

entities.name: Waste production
entities.description: Quantity of waste generated by the process

entities.name: Carbon footprint (CO2 emissions)
entities.description: Amount of CO2 emitted during the process

hyperedges.text: Perceived quality

entities.name: Process output
entities.description: Output of the AI or SWS in the context of AI4Work

entities.name: Operators
entities.description: Human actors involved in evaluating the output

entities.name: End-consumers
entities.description: Users of the system's output (when relevant)

hyperedges.text: Costs

entities.name: Process
entities.description: AI4Work process or operation

entities.name: Energy consumption
entities.description: Amount of energy used in the process

entities.name: Maintenance costs
entities.description: Costs associated with maintaining the system

entities.name: (Re-)configuration costs
entities.description: Costs associated with re-configuring or setting up the system

hyperedges.text: Flexibility

entities.name: AI4Work components
entities.description: Components of AI4Work system

entities.name: Re-configuration or set-up time
entities.description: Time required for a component to adjust to alternative context requirements

hyperedges.text: Productivity

entities.name: Process
entities.description: AI4Work process or operation

entities.name: Labour
entities.description: Human resources involved in the process

entities.name: (Physical) capital
entities.description: Physical resources used in the process

entities.name: Output units per unit (or batch) of input
entities.description: Measure of productivity for the process

hyperedges.text: Quality metrics measure the degree to which a process meets the demanded specifications or requirements. The quality of AI4Work tools can be measured by the amount of unsatisfactory output while the system operates either autonomously or in conjunction with human actors. Quality KPIs are relevant for manufacturing, construction, education, and healthcare pilots.

entities.name: Quality metrics
entities.description: Degree to which a process meets demanded specifications or requirements.

entities.name: AI4Work tools
entities.description: Tools incorporating AI for work applications.

entities.name: unsatisfactory output
entities.description: Result that does not meet specified quality standards.

entities.name: manufacturing
entities.description: Production of goods on a large scale.

entities.name: construction
entities.description: Building or constructing infrastructure.

entities.name: education
entities.description: Process of facilitating and guiding learning.

entities.name: healthcare
entities.description: Provision of medical services.

hyperedges.text: Return on investment is an investment's profitability measure. The return on investment of the system can be measured as the difference between the initial cost of introducing the AI4Work components in a process and the resulting expected discounted future marginal benefits. For instance, return on investment is relevant for the logistics, manufacturing, construction, and agriculture pilots. However, its measurement is less relevant within the project lifecycle and is more relevant in potential investment decisions afterwards.

entities.name: Return on investment
entities.description: Profitability measure of an investment.

entities.name: AI4Work components
entities.description: Individual parts or aspects of AI4Work system.

entities.name: process
entities.description: Series of actions or steps taken in executing a task or objective.

entities.name: logistics
entities.description: Management of the flow of goods between the point of origin and the point of consumption.

entities.name: manufacturing
entities.description: Production of goods on a large scale.

entities.name: construction
entities.description: Building or constructing infrastructure.

entities.name: agriculture
entities.description: Science, art, technology, and business of cultivating the soil, producing crops, and raising livestock.

hyperedges.text: Routing flexibility measures assess the capability of a process to complete an operation in multiple ways. In a traditional manufacturing environment, routing flexibility is measured as the number of ways a part type can be produced. In the AI4Work context, routing flexibility can be measured as the number of proposed ways (allocations) a task can be shared between human and AI actors.

entities.name: Routing flexibility
entities.description: Ability to complete an operation in multiple ways.

entities.name: part type
entities.description: Specific category of parts within a manufacturing process.

entities.name: traditional manufacturing environment
entities.description: Manufacturing processes without AI integration.

entities.name: AI4Work context
entities.description: Manufacturing processes with AI integration.

entities.name: task
entities.description: Series of actions or steps taken in executing a specific objective.

hyperedges.text: Human-centric KPIs primarily measure qualitative and quantitative aspects of work design from a human involvement perspective at the individual and organisational levels. They are relevant for measuring both blue- and white-collar work aspects [52].

entities.name: Human-centric KPIs
entities.description: Qualitative and quantitative measures of work design from a human perspective.

entities.name: work design
entities.description: Planning, organizing, and structuring of work tasks and processes.

entities.name: individual level
entities.description: Level of analysis focusing on an individual worker.

entities.name: organisational level
entities.description: Level of analysis focusing on the organization as a whole.

entities.name: blue-collar work aspects
entities.description: Manual, physical labor jobs.

entities.name: white-collar work aspects
entities.description: Mental, non-manual labor jobs.

hyperedges.text: Agency. Agency metrics traditionally measure the discretion of human agents when making decisions to carry out work (human agency). Agency can be measured via qualitative user assessments, e.g., questionnaires, interviews, and focus groups [53], [54], [55], [56], [57], [58]. For CPS with AI agents exhibiting autonomous behaviour, pre-application agency metrics and post-application operators' surveys can be used to evaluate the ability of AI actors to take over tasks requiring decision-making autonomy (technical agency).

entities.name: Agency
entities.description: Discretion of human or AI agents in making decisions.

entities.name: human agency
entities.description: Discretion of human agents in decision-making.

entities.name: qualitative user assessments
entities.description: Evaluation methods based on subjective, non-numerical data.

entities.name: questionnaires
entities.description: Standardized set of questions for gathering information.

entities.name: interviews
entities.description: One-on-one conversation to gather information.

entities.name: focus groups
entities.description: Group discussion to gather information.

entities.name: CPS with AI agents
entities.description: Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS) with integrated AI components.

entities.name: technical agency
entities.description: Ability of AI actors to take over tasks requiring decision-making autonomy.

hyperedges.text: AI Acceptance Measurements

entities.name: AI agents' presence in a work environment
entities.description: The AI systems or agents that are introduced into the workplace.

entities.name: questionnaires, interviews, focus groups
entities.description: Techniques used to measure acceptance of AI in a work environment.

entities.name: AI4Work's components
entities.description: The specific AI systems or components being integrated into work processes.

entities.name: telemetry and usage statistics
entities.description: Data collected to monitor the integration of AI4Work's components over time.

hyperedges.text: Ease of Use Metrics

entities.name: system's functionalities
entities.description: The various features or capabilities offered by the system.

entities.name: qualitative user assessment
entities.description: Evaluation of the system's ease of use based on user feedback and opinions.

entities.name: AI-human collaboration interface
entities.description: The specific interface where AI and human interact in the AI4Work context.

entities.name: usage statistics
entities.description: Data collected to measure the actual usage of the system over time.

hyperedges.text: Explainability Metrics

entities.name: system's decisions and rationale
entities.description: The actions taken by the AI system and the reasoning behind them.

entities.name: qualitative user assessments
entities.description: Evaluation of the system's explainability based on user feedback and opinions.

entities.name: frequency of users requesting explanations
entities.description: A measure of how often users ask for additional explanations of the system's decisions.

entities.name: time spent by users with explainability UI components
entities.description: The amount of time users spend interacting with the system's explainability features.

hyperedges.text: Fairness Assessments

entities.name: responsible data acquisition and management
entities.description: Ensuring that data is collected and managed in a fair and unbiased manner.

entities.name: design fairness
entities.description: Creating AI systems that are free from inherent biases during their design process.

entities.name: bias prevention in outcomes
entities.description: Ensuring that the AI system does not produce unfair or discriminatory results.

hyperedges.text: Feedback Metrics

entities.name: worker in an operational work environment
entities.description: The human worker who interacts with the AI system.

entities.name: user statistics and telemetry
entities.description: Data collected to measure the amount of feedback provided from human to AI agents.

entities.name: explainability KPIs
entities.description: Indicators measuring the degree of feedback provided by the AI system to human agents.

hyperedges.text: Inclusivity KPIs

entities.name: Inclusivity KPIs
entities.description: Quantify the practice of providing equal access to opportunities and resources for users.

entities.name: minority groups or traditionally misrepresented groups
entities.description: Users belonging to minority groups or traditionally misrepresented groups.

entities.name: Questionnaires
entities.description: Used to measure perceived inclusivity.

entities.name: telemetry and usage statistics
entities.description: Differences in telemetry and usage statistics between different user groups can be indicative of inclusivity issues.

hyperedges.text: Information processing KPIs

entities.name: Information processing KPIs
entities.description: Quantify the requirements of interpreting, gathering, and synthesising information for decision-making purposes.

entities.name: AI system
entities.description: Can process tasks or transactions in a given time frame.

entities.name: throughput
entities.description: Number of tasks or transactions the AI system can process in a given time frame.

hyperedges.text: Interdependence KPIs

entities.name: Interdependence KPIs
entities.description: Measure the degree to which process (human) actors depend on each other.

entities.name: questionnaires, interviews, and focus groups
entities.description: Used for collecting interdependence measurements.

hyperedges.text: Interpretability metrics

entities.name: Interpretability metrics
entities.description: Measure the ability to translate a system's working principles into human-understandable language.

entities.name: user surveys
entities.description: Used for measuring interpretability.

hyperedges.text: Mental demands measurements

entities.name: Mental demands measurements
entities.description: Quantify the cognitive costs associated with performing a task.

entities.name: questionnaires and surveys for human workers
entities.description: Used for measuring mental demands.

hyperedges.text: Physical demands

entities.name: Physical demands measurements
entities.description: Quantify the physical efforts associated with performing a work task.

entities.name: wearable devices
entities.description: Used for measuring physical demands KPIs.

entities.name: questionnaires
entities.description: Used for measuring physical demands KPIs.

entities.name: AI agents
entities.description: Not applicable to in terms of physical demands KPIs.

entities.name: work substitution effects
entities.description: Of interest for cases where work performed by robot agents is considered.

entities.name: agriculture and construction pilots
entities.description: Relevant for physical demand measurements.

hyperedges.text: Physical ergonomics

entities.name: physical ergonomics KPIs
entities.description: Reflect how a task or process allows workers to maintain correct postures and proper movements.

entities.name: qualitative user assessments
entities.description: Used to measure physical ergonomics for human actors.

entities.name: absenteeism due to health issues
entities.description: Can be indicative proxies for indirectly measuring the physical ergonomic aspects of specific tasks.

entities.name: in-work injuries
entities.description: Can be indicative proxies for indirectly measuring the physical ergonomic aspects of specific tasks.

entities.name: AI agents
entities.description: Less relevant for physical ergonomics KPIs.

hyperedges.text: Privacy

entities.name: privacy KPIs
entities.description: Measure a system's capacity to ensure informational privacy.

entities.name: SWS environments
entities.description: Relevant for privacy KPIs.

entities.name: workers' private sphere
entities.description: Privacy KPIs can measure the system's ability to respect this.

entities.name: right to control the dissemination of their data
entities.description: Privacy KPIs can measure the system's ability to respect this.

entities.name: incidents of unintended information leakage
entities.description: Can be used to measure privacy KPIs.

entities.name: healthcare and education pilots
entities.description: Relevant for privacy KPIs.

hyperedges.text: Problem-solving

entities.name: problem-solving KPIs
entities.description: Assess the degree of innovativeness required for completing a task.

entities.name: qualitative user assessments
entities.description: Can be used to measure the perceived problem-solving requirements of a task for humans.

entities.name: AI agents
entities.description: Pre-SWS application measurements can indirectly assess their problem-solving capacities from a human perspective.

hyperedges.text: Satisfaction

entities.name: satisfaction KPIs
entities.description: Measure an operator's contentment with a process' performance.

entities.description: Used for measuring satisfaction KPIs.

entities.description: Used for measuring satisfaction KPIs.

entities.name: focus groups
entities.description: Used for measuring satisfaction KPIs.

entities.name: AI4Work context
entities.description: Satisfaction metrics can be specialized for each pilot scenario and each deployed module.

hyperedges.text: Skill variety metrics measure the range of skills needed for a task or process.

entities.name: Skill variety
entities.description: Measures the range of skills required for a task.

entities.name: Qualitative user assessments
entities.description: Used to measure skill variety for human agents.

hyperedges.text: Stress KPIs measure the degree of mental or emotional strain resulting from demanding work circumstances.

entities.name: Stress
entities.description: Measures the level of mental or emotional strain.

entities.name: Qualitative user assessment
entities.description: Used to measure stress levels.

entities.name: Wearable devices
entities.description: Used to measure stress levels via physiological measurements.

hyperedges.text: Task variety KPIs quantify the variability and range of performed tasks.

entities.name: Task variety
entities.description: Quantifies the variability and range of tasks.

entities.name: Qualitative user assessment
entities.description: Used to measure task variety.

hyperedges.text: Work condition KPIs assess the appropriateness and appeal of the environment where a task is performed.

entities.name: Work conditions
entities.description: Assesses the appropriateness and appeal of the work environment.

entities.name: Questions based on work design questionnaires
entities.description: Used to measure work conditions.

hyperedges.text: The SWS Management approach based on fuzzy logic was used for the laboratory prototype.

entities.name: SWS Management
entities.description: Software system for managing the Sliding Window System (SWS)

entities.name: fuzzy logic
entities.description: A method used to deal with reasoning that is approximate rather than fixed and exact

entities.description: Experimental version of the SWS Management system

entities.name: jFuzzyLogic
entities.description: A Java library for fuzzy logic

entities.name: initial experiments
entities.description: Experiments conducted using the jFuzzyLogic library

hyperedges.text: The FCL was used to implement fuzzy rules.

entities.description: Fuzzy Control Language

entities.name: fuzzy rules
entities.description: Rules used to make decisions based on fuzzy logic

entities.description: Variable representing the AI's confidence level

entities.name: human experience level
entities.description: Variable representing the human's experience level

hyperedges.text: The 'suggested work sharing approach' was calculated as output.

entities.name: suggested work sharing approach
entities.description: Output representing the suggested work sharing approach

hyperedges.text: The membership functions were defined via the FCL.

entities.description: Functions defining the degree of membership in fuzzy sets

entities.description: Fuzzy Control Language

entities.description: Translation of input values via membership functions

hyperedges.text: Automation of packing lines in e-commerce sector

entities.name: automation
entities.description: Use of technology to operate machinery without human intervention

entities.name: packing lines
entities.description: Sequence of operations in the packaging process

entities.name: e-commerce sector
entities.description: Online retail industry

hyperedges.text: Challenges in recruitment for e-commerce sector

entities.name: recruitment
entities.description: The act of finding and hiring employees

entities.name: e-commerce sector
entities.description: Online retail industry

entities.name: specialized workers
entities.description: Employees with specific skills or expertise

hyperedges.text: The shift to advanced automated equipment introduces challenges for operators and maintainers in managing unforeseen situations and devising solutions for complex issues.

entities.name: operators
entities.description: Individuals responsible for operating machinery in a manufacturing plant.

entities.name: maintainers
entities.description: Individuals responsible for maintaining and repairing machinery in a manufacturing plant.

entities.name: complex issues
entities.description: Difficult problems that arise due to the use of advanced automated equipment.

hyperedges.text: Production managers face increased difficulty in coordinating plant activities and aligning workforce skills with operational needs.

entities.name: production managers
entities.description: Individuals responsible for overseeing the production process in a manufacturing plant.

entities.name: plant activities
entities.description: The various tasks and processes involved in the production of goods in a manufacturing plant.

entities.name: workforce skills
entities.description: The abilities and expertise of the employees in a manufacturing plant.

entities.name: operational needs
entities.description: The requirements necessary to efficiently produce goods in a manufacturing plant.

hyperedges.text: Automated packing technologies can simplify workers' tasks but demand a higher level of problem-solving and planning expertise.

entities.name: workers
entities.description: Individuals responsible for performing tasks in a manufacturing plant.

entities.name: packing technologies
entities.description: Automated systems used for packaging goods.

entities.name: problem-solving expertise
entities.description: The ability to find solutions to complex problems.

entities.name: planning expertise
entities.description: The ability to plan and organize tasks effectively.

hyperedges.text: Artificial intelligence (AI) can support inexperienced operators and assist managers in decision-making.

entities.name: inexperienced operators
entities.description: Operators with limited experience.

entities.name: managers
entities.description: Individuals responsible for making decisions in a manufacturing plant.

entities.name: artificial intelligence (AI)
entities.description: Intelligent systems that can perform tasks without human intervention.

hyperedges.text: The AI4Work initiative aims to address packaging challenges by focusing on troubleshooting unexpected failures, guiding operators in routine tasks, and optimizing plant activity planning.

entities.name: AI4Work
entities.description: An initiative focused on integrating AI into manufacturing processes.

entities.name: packaging challenges
entities.description: Difficulties encountered in the packaging process of goods.

entities.name: troubleshooting unexpected failures
entities.description: Identifying and resolving unforeseen issues in the packaging process.

entities.name: guiding operators in routine tasks
entities.description: Assisting operators with repetitive tasks in the packaging process.

entities.name: optimizing plant activity planning
entities.description: Improving the organization and scheduling of tasks in a manufacturing plant to increase productivity.

hyperedges.text: AI4Work envisions innovative methods to effectively balance human resources with AI and robotic systems.

entities.name: AI4Work
entities.description: An initiative focused on integrating AI into manufacturing processes.

entities.name: human resources
entities.description: The workforce in a manufacturing plant.

entities.name: AI
entities.description: Intelligent systems that can perform tasks without human intervention.

entities.name: robotic systems
entities.description: Automated machines and robots used in manufacturing processes.

hyperedges.text: By integrating AI with tools like digital twins, companies can enhance collaboration between humans and machines.

entities.name: companies
entities.description: Business entities involved in manufacturing.

entities.name: AI
entities.description: Intelligent systems that can perform tasks without human intervention.

entities.name: digital twins
entities.description: Virtual representations of physical assets or processes.

hyperedges.text: The Digital Assistant is proposed to leverage accumulated knowledge from past operator experiences to offer real-time guidance during troubleshooting activities.

entities.name: Digital Assistant
entities.description: An AI-powered tool designed to assist operators with troubleshooting.

entities.name: past operator experiences
entities.description: The collective knowledge gained by operators through their work history.

hyperedges.text: A troubleshooting tool analyzes faults and provides recommendations using machine status and historical data.

entities.name: troubleshooting tool
entities.description: Analyzes faults and provides recommendations.

entities.name: machine status
entities.description: Status of machines.

entities.name: historical data
entities.description: Data related to past events.

hyperedges.text: It should identify new or unknown faults not yet present in the database.

entities.name: it
entities.description: Identifies new or unknown faults.

entities.name: new faults
entities.description: Faults not yet present in the database.

hyperedges.text: A digital twin should simulate machine behaviour, enabling fault association with operating conditions.

entities.name: digital twin
entities.description: Simulates machine behavior.

entities.name: machine behaviour
entities.description: Behavior of machines.

entities.name: operating conditions
entities.description: Conditions under which machines operate.

hyperedges.text: The virtual assistant must facilitate training activities and support operators in developing expertise.

entities.name: virtual assistant
entities.description: Facilitates training activities.

entities.name: operators
entities.description: Machine operators.

entities.name: expertise
entities.description: Expertise in machine operations and maintenance.

hyperedges.text: It must accept and respond to natural language queries to ease user interaction.

entities.name: it
entities.description: Accepts and responds to natural language queries.

hyperedges.text: Answers provided should consider the user's skill level to tailor responses effectively.

entities.name: it
entities.description: Considers user's skill level.

hyperedges.text: The assistant may also identify machine conditions requiring human intervention to offer proactive support.

entities.name: assistant
entities.description: Identifies machine conditions requiring human intervention.

hyperedges.text: The tool must generate automated production plans that optimize resource utilization.

entities.name: tool
entities.description: Generates automated production plans.

entities.name: resource utilization
entities.description: Optimizing resource utilization.

hyperedges.text: It should consider constraints like raw material availability and human resources.

entities.name: it
entities.description: Considers constraints like raw material availability and human resources.

hyperedges.text: Plans must dynamically adapt to workload balancing requests.

entities.name: plans
entities.description: Adapt to workload balancing requests.

hyperedges.text: Digital twins should simulate production line scenarios, modelling both human and machine performance.

entities.name: digital twin
entities.description: Simulates production line scenarios.

entities.name: human and machine performance
entities.description: Performance of humans and machines in production line scenarios.

hyperedges.text: Troubleshooting system integration

entities.name: Data Collection and Handling for AI/Robotics Services
entities.description: Collects and processes real-time machine data to identify and analyze faults.

entities.name: Human-Centred Digital Twins
entities.description: Simulates machine behaviour and past fault conditions, allowing operators to visualize and test solutions virtually.

entities.name: Context Awareness
entities.description: Adapts troubleshooting recommendations based on the machine's current operating context and historical data.

entities.name: Sliding Work Sharing
entities.description: Enables flexible collaboration between humans and machines, allowing operators to focus on high-priority issues while AI manages routine troubleshooting.

hyperedges.text: Training system integration

entities.name: Data Collection and Handling for AI/Robotics Services
entities.description: Centralizes training data from operator manuals and real-time machine usage to create adaptive training modules.

entities.name: Pilot-Specific Digital Twin
entities.description: Provides virtual environments where operators can practice procedures and interact with simulated machines.

entities.name: Context Awareness
entities.description: Personalized training content to match the operator's skill level and the machine's current state.

entities.name: Sliding Work Sharing
entities.description: Allows the system to distribute training tasks dynamically, balancing human learning efforts with automated guidance.

entities.name: Natural Language Processing
entities.description: Facilitates intuitive, conversational interactions between operators and the virtual training assistant.

entities.name: Machine HMI
entities.description: Enables humans to interact with the primary functions of the packaging machine.

hyperedges.text: AI4Work Architecture adapted for the EP of the Manufacturing Pilot – Use Case 2

entities.name: AI4Work
entities.description: An integrated approach for optimizing resource utilization and maintaining high productivity in manufacturing operations.

entities.name: Operators
entities.description: Human workers operating complex machinery in a manufacturing setting.

entities.name: Data Collection and Handling for AI/Robotics Services
entities.description: Gathers data on resource availability, production demands, and operational constraints.

entities.name: Human-Centred Digital Twins
entities.description: Simulates production scenarios including human operators to test and refine schedules before implementation.

entities.name: Human-Aware Task Planning
entities.description: Plans the workflow of operators and machines, considering human expertise and availability.

entities.name: Context Awareness
entities.description: Aware of a context change, such as machine status, order priorities, and resource availability.

entities.name: Sliding Work Sharing
entities.description: Enables flexible task allocation and efficient collaboration between human operators and automated systems.

entities.name: Line Managers
entities.description: Individuals responsible for optimizing resource utilization and maintaining high productivity in a manufacturing setting.

hyperedges.text: Populate the experience storage with 500 entries [March ‘25]. Experience data are collected from the field, although in the early stages of development, in the absence of full-scale installations, most historical data is generated in protected environments or laboratory setups. Collected entries may or may not include faulty conditions that require troubleshooting.

entities.name: experience storage
entities.description: A system used to store experience data

entities.name: 500 entries
entities.description: The number of entries to be stored

entities.name: March ‘25
entities.description: The date when the experience storage will be filled with 500 entries

hyperedges.text: Assistance success rate of 80% in a virtual environment [June ‘25]. At the end of the early prototype stage, the quality of collected information must be sufficient to provide evidence of successful troubleshooting in the 80% of the fault conditions recorded.

entities.name: assistance success rate
entities.description: The percentage of successful troubleshooting
The expected success rate for troubleshooting

entities.name: June ‘25
entities.description: The date when the success rate of 80% will be achieved

hyperedges.text: Supervised service training for 50 situations [December ‘24]. In an initial phase, the specific AI will be trained using the troubleshooting manuals of the machines concerned.

entities.name: supervised service training
entities.description: A type of training where a human expert oversees the learning process

entities.name: 50 situations
entities.description: The number of situations for which the AI will be trained

entities.name: December ‘24
entities.description: The starting date for supervised service training

hyperedges.text: Assistance success rate of 80% in a virtual environment [March ‘25]. In the event of an alarm, the machine stops, and the specific AI activates its training support function.

entities.name: assistance success rate
entities.description: The percentage of successful troubleshooting
The expected success rate for troubleshooting

entities.name: March ‘25
entities.description: The date when the success rate of 80% will be achieved in a virtual environment

hyperedges.text: Replicate previous goals adopting continuous training [June ‘25]. During the training process, the specific AI will store the actions performed by the operator that led to the actual resolution of the problem through a semantic representation.

entities.name: continuous training
entities.description: A type of training where learning continues over time

entities.name: June ‘25
entities.description: The date when continuous training will be adopted

hyperedges.text: O3.1 Optimise a 1-obj. problem involving 1 line, N packaging operators, 1 replenishment operator [December ‘24].

entities.name: Optimisation Problem
entities.description: Involves a single objective and a line with one E-CO Flex machine, N packaging operators (N >= 2), and one replenishment operator.

entities.name: Early Prototype
entities.description: Schedules the replenishment of a packaging line to minimize the number of replenishment actions.

hyperedges.text: O3.2 Implement 3D DES interfacing with O3.1 assessing plan execution time [June ‘25].

entities.name: Integration
entities.description: Between the Early Prototype and a 3D DES, testing the integration with data from IMA (CAD and designs) and FBK (production plans).

entities.name: Early Prototype
entities.description: Simulates a single line with N packaging bays and one E-CO Flex machine, testing the replenishment policy and estimating execution time.

hyperedges.text: 4.5 Prototype Iteration Cycle

entities.name: Iterative Methodology
entities.description: Involves a collaborative interaction between technology providers and the end-user (IMA), testing, feedback collection, and refinement.

entities.name: AI4Work Prototypes
entities.description: Developed following this iterative methodology to align with operational needs.

hyperedges.text: The iterative process involves digital twins, context-aware systems, R&D and business unit staff, and simulates and anticipates the impact of changes before implementation.

entities.name: iterative process
entities.description: A series of actions repeated in regular succession.

entities.name: digital twins
entities.description: Virtual replicas that represent physical assets or processes.

entities.name: context-aware systems
entities.description: Systems capable of responding to and adapting to changes in their environment.

entities.name: R&D staff
entities.description: Research and development personnel.

entities.name: business unit staff
entities.description: Employees working in specific business areas or departments.

entities.name: implementation
entities.description: The process of putting a plan or design into effect.

hyperedges.text: The prototype iteration cycle consists of early prototype, final prototype, testing, feedback collection, and refinement stages.

entities.name: prototype iteration cycle
entities.description: A series of stages in the development and improvement of a prototype.

entities.name: early prototype
entities.description: The initial stage of prototype development.

entities.name: final prototype
entities.description: The final stage of prototype development.

entities.name: testing
entities.description: Evaluating the performance and functionality of a prototype.

entities.name: feedback collection
entities.description: Gathering opinions, comments, or suggestions about a prototype.

entities.name: refinement
entities.description: Improving the design, functionality, or performance of a prototype.

hyperedges.text: The early prototype stage involves IMA technicians performing predefined tasks and identifying areas for improvement.

entities.name: early prototype stage
entities.description: The initial stage of prototype development.

entities.name: IMA technicians
entities.description: Technical staff working at IMA.

entities.name: predefined tasks
entities.description: Specified or planned actions to be performed.

entities.name: areas for improvement
entities.description: Parts of a system that need modification or optimization.
